Utility Functions

Source: R/calculations.R
calculations.Rd

Common utility functions

Returns a tibble of summary stats

Usage

change(df, cols, digits = 3)

years_df(df, date_col)

years_vec(date_col)

duration_vec(date_col)

summary_stats(
  df,
  condition = NULL,
  group_vars = NULL,
  summary_vars = NULL,
  arr = NULL,
  digits = 3
)

gen_data(years)

Arguments

df

data frame

cols

numeric columns

digits

Number of digits to round to, default is 3

date_col

date column

condition

filter condition, i.e. patient == "new"

group_vars

variables to group by, i.e. c(specialty, state, hcpcs, cost)

summary_vars

variables to summarise, i.e. c(min, max, mode, range)

arr

column to arrange data by, i.e. cost

years

sequence of years, e.g. 2010:2020

Value

tibble() or vector

tibble

Examples

# Example data
ex <- gen_data(2020:2025)
ex
#> # A tibble: 12 × 3
#>     year group   pay
#>    <int> <chr> <int>
#>  1  2020 A      1826
#>  2  2021 A      1024
#>  3  2022 A      1046
#>  4  2023 A      1467
#>  5  2024 A      1052
#>  6  2025 A      1000
#>  7  2020 B      1659
#>  8  2021 B      1217
#>  9  2022 B      1294
#> 10  2023 B      1456
#> 11  2024 B      1600
#> 12  2025 B      1176

# Lagged calculations
# `change()` # Change, percentage change, and cumulative sum
ex |>
dplyr::filter(group == "A") |>
change(pay)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 7
#>    year group   pay pay_chg pay_chg_cum pay_pct pay_pct_cum
#>   <int> <chr> <int>   <int>       <int>   <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1  2020 A      1826       0           0   0          0     
#> 2  2021 A      1024    -802        -802  -0.439     -0.439 
#> 3  2022 A      1046      22        -780   0.021     -0.418 
#> 4  2023 A      1467     421        -359   0.402     -0.0160
#> 5  2024 A      1052    -415        -774  -0.283     -0.299 
#> 6  2025 A      1000     -52        -826  -0.049     -0.348 

# `chg()` # Absolute change for a vector
ex |>
dplyr::filter(group == "A") |>
dplyr::mutate(change = chg(pay))
#> # A tibble: 6 × 4
#>    year group   pay change
#>   <int> <chr> <int>  <int>
#> 1  2020 A      1826      0
#> 2  2021 A      1024   -802
#> 3  2022 A      1046     22
#> 4  2023 A      1467    421
#> 5  2024 A      1052   -415
#> 6  2025 A      1000    -52

# `pct()` # Percentage change for a vector
ex |>
dplyr::filter(group == "A") |>
dplyr::mutate(pct_change = pct(pay))
#> # A tibble: 6 × 4
#>    year group   pay pct_change
#>   <int> <chr> <int>      <dbl>
#> 1  2020 A      1826     0     
#> 2  2021 A      1024    -0.439 
#> 3  2022 A      1046     0.0215
#> 4  2023 A      1467     0.402 
#> 5  2024 A      1052    -0.283 
#> 6  2025 A      1000    -0.0494

# `ror()` # Rate of return
ex |>
dplyr::filter(group == "A") |>
ror(pay)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 4
#>    year group   pay pay_ror
#>   <int> <chr> <int>   <dbl>
#> 1  2020 A      1826  NA    
#> 2  2021 A      1024   0.561
#> 3  2022 A      1046   1.02 
#> 4  2023 A      1467   1.40 
#> 5  2024 A      1052   0.717
#> 6  2025 A      1000   0.951

# `geomean()` # Geometric mean
ex |>
dplyr::filter(group == "A") |>
ror(pay) |>
dplyr::summarise(gmean = geomean(pay_ror))
#> # A tibble: 1 × 1
#>   gmean
#>   <dbl>
#> 1 0.887

# `change_year()` # Lagged change by column
ex |>
dplyr::filter(group == "A") |>
change_year(pay, year)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 5
#>    year group   pay pay_chg pay_pct
#>   <int> <chr> <int>   <int>   <dbl>
#> 1  2020 A      1826      NA  NA    
#> 2  2021 A      1024    -802  -0.439
#> 3  2022 A      1046      22   0.021
#> 4  2023 A      1467     421   0.402
#> 5  2024 A      1052    -415  -0.283
#> 6  2025 A      1000     -52  -0.049

#' # When performing a `group_by()`, watch for
# the correct order of the variables
ex |>
dplyr::group_by(group) |>
change(pay)
#> # A tibble: 12 × 7
#> # Groups:   group [2]
#>     year group   pay pay_chg pay_chg_cum pay_pct pay_pct_cum
#>    <int> <chr> <int>   <int>       <int>   <dbl>       <dbl>
#>  1  2020 A      1826       0           0   0          0     
#>  2  2021 A      1024    -802        -802  -0.439     -0.439 
#>  3  2022 A      1046      22        -780   0.021     -0.418 
#>  4  2023 A      1467     421        -359   0.402     -0.0160
#>  5  2024 A      1052    -415        -774  -0.283     -0.299 
#>  6  2025 A      1000     -52        -826  -0.049     -0.348 
#>  7  2020 B      1659       0           0   0          0     
#>  8  2021 B      1217    -442        -442  -0.266     -0.266 
#>  9  2022 B      1294      77        -365   0.063     -0.203 
#> 10  2023 B      1456     162        -203   0.125     -0.078 
#> 11  2024 B      1600     144         -59   0.099      0.0210
#> 12  2025 B      1176    -424        -483  -0.265     -0.244 

ex |>
dplyr::group_by(group) |>
ror(pay)
#> # A tibble: 12 × 4
#> # Groups:   group [2]
#>     year group   pay pay_ror
#>    <int> <chr> <int>   <dbl>
#>  1  2020 A      1826  NA    
#>  2  2021 A      1024   0.561
#>  3  2022 A      1046   1.02 
#>  4  2023 A      1467   1.40 
#>  5  2024 A      1052   0.717
#>  6  2025 A      1000   0.951
#>  7  2020 B      1659  NA    
#>  8  2021 B      1217   0.734
#>  9  2022 B      1294   1.06 
#> 10  2023 B      1456   1.13 
#> 11  2024 B      1600   1.10 
#> 12  2025 B      1176   0.735

ex |>
dplyr::group_by(group) |>
ror(pay) |>
change(pay)
#> # A tibble: 12 × 8
#> # Groups:   group [2]
#>     year group   pay pay_ror pay_chg pay_chg_cum pay_pct pay_pct_cum
#>    <int> <chr> <int>   <dbl>   <int>       <int>   <dbl>       <dbl>
#>  1  2020 A      1826  NA           0           0   0          0     
#>  2  2021 A      1024   0.561    -802        -802  -0.439     -0.439 
#>  3  2022 A      1046   1.02       22        -780   0.021     -0.418 
#>  4  2023 A      1467   1.40      421        -359   0.402     -0.0160
#>  5  2024 A      1052   0.717    -415        -774  -0.283     -0.299 
#>  6  2025 A      1000   0.951     -52        -826  -0.049     -0.348 
#>  7  2020 B      1659  NA           0           0   0          0     
#>  8  2021 B      1217   0.734    -442        -442  -0.266     -0.266 
#>  9  2022 B      1294   1.06       77        -365   0.063     -0.203 
#> 10  2023 B      1456   1.12      162        -203   0.125     -0.078 
#> 11  2024 B      1600   1.10      144         -59   0.099      0.0210
#> 12  2025 B      1176   0.735    -424        -483  -0.265     -0.244 

ex |>
dplyr::group_by(group) |>
ror(pay) |>
dplyr::summarise(gmean = geomean(pay_ror))
#> # A tibble: 2 × 2
#>   group gmean
#>   <chr> <dbl>
#> 1 A     0.887
#> 2 B     0.933

# Calculating Timespans
dt <- dplyr::tibble(date = lubridate::today() - 366)
dt
#> # A tibble: 1 × 1
#>   date      
#>   <date>    
#> 1 2022-10-18

# `years_df()`/`years_vec()` # Years passed
years_df(dt, date)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   date       years_passed
#>   <date>            <dbl>
#> 1 2022-10-18            1

dplyr::mutate(dt, years = years_vec(date))
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   date       years
#>   <date>     <dbl>
#> 1 2022-10-18     1

# `duration_vec()` # Duration since date
dplyr::mutate(dt, dur = duration_vec(date))
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   date       dur                   
#>   <date>     <Duration>            
#> 1 2022-10-18 -31622400s (~-1 years)


# Summary Statistics
sm <- dplyr::tibble(provider = sample(c("A", "B", "C"), size = 200, replace = TRUE),
                    city = sample(c("ATL", "NYC"), size = 200, replace = TRUE),
                    charges = sample(1000:2000, size = 200),
                    payment = sample(1000:2000, size = 200))

head(sm)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 4
#>   provider city  charges payment
#>   <chr>    <chr>   <int>   <int>
#> 1 B        ATL      1226    1739
#> 2 C        ATL      1801    1815
#> 3 B        ATL      1241    1001
#> 4 B        ATL      1118    1108
#> 5 A        ATL      1111    1502
#> 6 B        NYC      1046    1852

summary_stats(sm,
              condition = city == "ATL",
              group_vars = provider,
              summary_vars = c(charges, payment),
              arr = provider)
#> # A tibble: 3 × 8
#>   provider charges_median charges_mean charges_sd payment_median payment_mean
#>   <chr>             <dbl>        <dbl>      <dbl>          <dbl>        <dbl>
#> 1 C                 1356         1391.       253.          1523         1555.
#> 2 B                 1590.        1552.       310.          1514.        1494.
#> 3 A                 1454.        1484.       293.          1522.        1470.
#> # ℹ 2 more variables: payment_sd <dbl>, n <int>
